title: Queentoshi
author: Queentoshi
content: Do you think social media is now becoming more a place for business than socializing, Could it be as a result of digitalization and things moving online or more people now starting business online because of need to somehow generate income or another source of income for self to survive the economic situations which is becoming tougher?

comments.author: hatshepsut93
comments.body: Business is also a part of social life, I don't see how it's wrong to have it in social media. Most social media allow you to curate what to see, I personally don't have commercial content in my news feeds. As automation of our industry increases. more and more jobs will move towards the Internet, perhaps in a few decades a majority of work will happen there, so it's not strange that social media are increasingly more commonly used for business.

comments.author: Lanatsa
comments.body: Quote from: Queentoshi on July 26, 2022, 11:04:05 PMDo you think social media is now becoming more a place for business than socializing, Could it be as a result of digitalization and things moving online or more people now starting business online because of need to somehow generate income or another source of income for self to survive the economic situations which is becoming tougher?Could really be on the same time and its not surprising and come to think that social medias do really even offer some ads spaces for their income too which means that theres mutual benefit and its just common sensethat people would really be using up these platforms to advertise considering on how big the traffic is within these places which means it would really be just right for them to consider on allocating some and budgetfor them expose or marketing into their product or services and also you couldnt restrict out socializing just for your business yet you could really do both things at the same time.Its just normal for people to look for alternative income no matter what forms it would be.

comments.author: Hydrogen
comments.body: There is a high percentage of stolen content circulating on social media platforms. Most of the smart content is published by accounts with fewer than 1k followers. Then reposed by accounts with more than 50k followers. It is a strange dynamic.Everyone is scrambling for clout and credibility. Trying to increase their follower count and marketability. All of the clickbait angles and begging for retweets, likes and followers seems to have devalued and cheapened some of the relationship between content creators and their followings.And after decades of being bombarded by commercials and advertisements. A high percentage of people appear to have stopped blindly believing everything they see on a screen. And on some level, began to think more for themselves, independently.Having lots of views and follower interaction translates directly to more money from ads. And so yes it does seem that profiteering motives and business is a leading motive behind much of it.

comments.author: Zlantann
comments.body: For people in the developing world that is desperately in need for alternative source of income, social media becoming a business media is a big blessing. Most people have been able to provide their basic needs by engaging in business activities on social media. But this blessing comes with its own challenges. Social media scam and fraud has increased drastically. Now we have fake business claiming they offer certain goods or servicing but their sole aim is to dupe people of their hard earned money. We have also seen celebrities or public figures with high fellowship advertising and promoting these fake or fraudulent businesses. Regulating the social media might be an affront to freedom of speech but I feel businesses on social media need some form of control.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: It's precisely socializing that is their primary business. People go to social media to interact with a larger group. They're there for communicating with friends and loved ones who are either near or far. But the convenience of social media in terms of communication and socializing in general has actually made a lot of effects outside plain socializing. And these social media companies are quick to take advantage of them. Users, for example, are bombarded with ads of products and services to their interest and liking. And since social media have larger populations than towns and even cities and countries, it has become a honeypot for businesses to promote and sell their products and services. Social media companies are allowing all this not only because it makes them more popular but also because it increases their revenue.

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: Social media starts to be business depending on the number of followers you have. The moment you pass a threshold of followers you can monetise your content, and there are few who do not. There are also a lot of ads on social media. The remaining part of social is the people who have followers from the threshold and use social media to interact with them, to pass the time.

comments.body: Quote from: Queentoshi on July 26, 2022, 11:04:05 PMDo you think social media is now becoming more a place for business than socializing, Could it be as a result of digitalization and things moving online or more people now starting business online because of need to somehow generate income or another source of income for self to survive the economic situations which is becoming tougher?Social media and business can go hand in hand. Social media can be a means for people to run a business because there are so many people interacting on social media so that the reach for a company to promote business products is greatly helped through social media.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: The emergence of social networks has allowed people to increase their circle of communication and business. Previously, a person would have managed with his circle of acquaintances and spent money to advertise his product; today, all of this is much cheaper, and in some cases completely free.It saddens me that the intrusive ads that users are offered to view are so strong that many have to give up social networking altogether.Initially, the idea of creating such networks had good prerequisites, but today it has turned into chaos, where it is very difficult to guess whether you are communicating with a normal person or a scammer who is sitting on the other side.

comments.author: wxa7115

comments.body: Quote from: Queentoshi on July 26, 2022, 11:04:05 PMDo you think social media is now becoming more a place for business than socializing, Could it be as a result of digitalization and things moving online or more people now starting business online because of need to somehow generate income or another source of income for self to survive the economic situations which is becoming tougher?It's a very good change! comments.author: ethereumhunter
comments.body: I think so because more and more people are trying to sell their goods through social media. They try to sell the goods to their friends; many are satisfied with the goods and recommend them to other friends. This is what makes social media has changed from just a place to socialize to a place to make money and we have seen many people who have succeeded by selling through social media. People are doing this to survive this pandemic and many people have already lost their jobs in real life so they are trying to sell something through social media that works.
